sentences.english: Irony is beginning to make some incursions into the straight-faced bastion of mainstream print media.
sentences.chinese: 反諷正在入侵一些面無表情的主流印刷媒體。

sentences.english: Irony is a common pragmatic phenomenon in verbal communication.
sentences.chinese: 反諷即說反話，是言語交際中一種常見的語用現象。

sentences.english: And, Westward Journey is another ironic film which is popular for many years.
sentences.chinese: 《大話西遊》則是一部極具本土特色的反諷電影。

sentences.english: The"irony and esteem"presented two sides of researching the art of Anselm Kiefer .
sentences.chinese: 正是“反諷與敬重”呈現了基弗藝術研究的雙重意義。

sentences.english: Perhaps more than an ambiguity, it was an irony of history.
sentences.chinese: 也許那並非一宗歷史的懸案，而只是一段反諷。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of twists and ironies in the history of these discoveries.
sentences.chinese: 回顧四十年前開始的歷程，不乏曲折和反諷。

sentences.english: The use of irony and mechanism for distinguishing irony from non-irony present a strong cognitive quality and pragmatic effects.
sentences.chinese: 反諷的識別與使用具有很強的認知性與語用效力。

sentences.english: With peals of distant ironical laughter at every word I have written.
sentences.chinese: 隆隆作響的反諷遙笑我逐字逐句記在心裏了去。

sentences.english: He was satirizing common beliefs by and about Americans.
sentences.chinese: 他只是在反諷美國人的共同信仰。

sentences.english: Rhetoric-irony is the inevitable result of self-rethink in the development of man's culture.
sentences.chinese: 反諷是人類文化發展中自我反思的必然結果。

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
